intro: Tapura negrensis, commonly known as the Negrensis tapura, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are broad and ovate, often with a velvety texture. Tapura negrensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
